Posts.Title: Shelli's Obituary and Flower info geeta75 spicecakeforever

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2008 08:37PM Heidi521 wrote: I was 90 % ER + and 70% PR+I gained no weight during chemo. Then I did lupron and tamoxifen and now arimidex. I have gained 25 pounds over the past 3 years! Now I am on a serious weight loss/exercise plan. It was much easier to loose before. But the good thing is-I am always hungry!!! But I keep telling myself I am glad to be alive so I am trying to adjust to the fact that I probably won't be a size 10 with a nice waist again!! Hopefully you will be able to regulate it! Heidi
Posts.Title: Weight Firelady snowyday

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2007 11:29PM Heidi521 wrote: Hi everyone- Just checking in to let you know I think of all of you and lurk every now and then Kim I am sorry to hear about what your FIL is going through. Thank goodness he has you! We have gotten busy, like we didn't say we would get again, but it is so much fun living life! Othe rthan fighting off an upper respiratory infection we are doing well. Jeremy will be five in February and starting school next year. It is hard to believe. We were in Disney over thanksgiving because my husband's choral group sang in the candlelight processional. It was incredible, very inspiring! Hope you all have a wonderful holiday. I still pray for you all every night! Heidi

Posts.Content: Heidi521 wrote: Hi-to all my stage 3 sisters-I was diagnosed back in October 2004. I am on my way to my 5 years mark. Only I am not going to be celebrating with my husband, by then he will be my ex. He does not want to be married anymore he informed me. I was devastated at first, but as time has gone on (that was 4 months ago) I am accepting it and ready to move on. I think it is because I am a cancer survivor, that I think if I survived that I can survive anything. He was with me during my chemo, surgery and radiation, so I am grateful that he supported me during that time. I am hoping it is a midlife crisis.  So girls if I have any advice for you it is make the most of each day! For yourself. No one would ever have imagined this would be happening to me-we appeared to be the perfect family. Not only was I blindsided by cancer in my mid 30's but now I am going to be a single parent in my 40's! We can do anything girls! Stay strong, I am going to! If God brings you to it He will see you through it! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I Am Getting Divorced Heidi521 wallan

Posts.Title: I'm going to be 40 tomorrow!!! Heidi521 Heidi521

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2009 05:55AM Heidi521 wrote: Wow! I was just on here looking to see if anyone else was getting the boniva. My onc said he is watching a study on this and wanted me to take it. I was diagnosed in Oct 2004 -close to your diagnosis and ER+. I took the boniva twice and I think I had more indigestion than I ever did before. I am going to take it again tomorrow and cut out coffee and orange juice for the day and see if that changes anything. Other than that I haven't noticed anything. Heidi
Posts.Title: Prophalactic Boniva ejlj nastazia_s

Posts.Content: Heidi521 wrote: Hello- I check in on all of you, at least once a week, but I don't post too much. I had to post to share my good news. I am turning 40. I am so happy that I made it to my 40th birthday. That was one of my goals when I got diagnosed at 36 at stage 3. Most people dread 40, I couldn't wait because it would mean I would be almost 4 years out from my cancer!!! My husband is throwing a nice dinner party for me. Those of you who are just starting this journey-keep the faith, get through your treatment-you can do it! Heidi If God brings you to it He will see you through it! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'm going to be 40 tomorrow!!! Heidi521 Heidi521
